item.title: Name_Change_Function
item.description: gsub() is a useful core R function which can be used to detect certain character strings and replace them with others. However, if a multitude of changes needs to be made to a vector of character strings, it can be tedious to write a long list of gsub() lines. Additionally, testing each line may require many print functions and bloat the console. Below is a loop function to make any number of changes to character strings through the use of gsub() with just three line of code.
